intro: Phyllanthus urinaria subsp. urinaria, commonly known as stonebreaker or bladder nut, is a small shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain smooth, kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a resilient species with potential medicinal uses.
